shred noun
(CUT)
[ C usually plural ] a very small, thin piece that has been torn from something: Cut the radishes into shreds to garnish the plates. in shreds
very badly torn: My shirt was in shreds when I took it out of the washer.
badly damaged: The report has left the CEO's reputation in shreds.

shred verb
(TEAR)
[ T ] to cut or tear something roughly into thin strips: Shred the lettuce and arrange it around the edge of the dish. shredded carrot/paper
to tear a document into strips, especially in a machine, in order to destroy it: He ordered his secretary to shred important documents when government inspectors started investigating his business affairs.
